thread.title: How rich is Jordan Spieth? See how his record earnings compare with top-paid D-FW athletes in 2015
thread.title_full: How rich is Jordan Spieth? See how his record earnings compare with top-paid D-FW athletes in 2015 | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: How rich is Jordan Spieth? See how his record earnings compare with top-paid D-FW athletes in 2015
text:
Jordan Spieth has had himself quite the year.
First he won The Masters, then the U.S. Open. Add in a pair of top-five finishes in the other two majors of the year, and Spieth had one of the most successful golfing campaigns in recent history.
Oh, and he earned a $10 million bonus Sunday for finishing first atop the FedEx Cup standings. That considerable bonus brought his yearly earnings to just more than $22 million -- not bad for a 22-year-old.
Spieth's $22,030,465 in on-the-field earnings puts him second among Dallas-Fort Worth athletes for 2015, according to information from the PGA Tour and Spotrac.com.
Here's a look at the top 15 earners based on their 2015 or 2015-16 salary numbers. Note that endorsements and off-the-field ventures are not included:
Rank Athlete Team/Sport 2015 salary 1. Prince Fielder Rangers $24,000,000 2. Jordan Spieth Golf $22,030,465 3. Wesley Matthews Mavericks $16,407,500 4. Adrian Beltre Rangers $16,000,000 5. Chandler Parsons Mavericks $15,361,500 6. Elvis Andrus Rangers $15,000,000 7. Tony Romo Cowboys $14,973,000 8. Shin-Soo Choo Rangers $14,000,000 9. Yovani Gallardo Rangers $14,000,000 10. Brandon Carr Cowboys $12,717,000 11. Jason Witten Cowboys $8,512,000 12. Cole Hamels Rangers $8,360,655 13. Dirk Nowitzki Mavericks $8,333,334 14. Tyler Seguin Stars $7,500,000 15. Derek Holland Rangers $7,400,000 Our favorite Spieth stories
